qas.question: Who designed the City of Arts and Sciences?
Where is the bridge named for Calatrava located?
What type of architecture does the Music Palace have?
Which of Calatrava's creations contains an IMAX theater?

context: World-renowned (and city-born) architect <a0_0>Santiago Calatrava<a0_0/> produced the futuristic <a3_0>City of Arts and Sciences<a3_0/> (Ciutat de les Arts i les Ciències), which contains an opera house/performing arts centre, a science museum, an IMAX cinema/planetarium, an oceanographic park and other structures such as a long covered walkway and restaurants. Calatrava is also responsible for the bridge named after him in the <a1_0>centre of the city<a1_0/>. The Music Palace (Palau De La Música) is another noteworthy example of <a2_0>modern<a2_0/> architecture in Valencia.
